Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: LEEHOM
Reviews.Content: 1 hour review.Pros:Fast - Quad-core CPUDesign - Love the slick, compact design with camera features. Reminds me of my old K750i. Roughly the same size as the Galaxy S2Screen - Bright, clear and the viewing angles isn't an issue for meOS - Sony's typical foot print. I prefer this over Tmobile or any carriers in general because they don't install a ton of bloatwareCamera - Very nice, the smile shutter? feature is awesome. Taking pictures in 9m mode will be 16x9 formatCons:Speaker isn't as loud or clear as previous Sony phonesPhone runs HOT. Was looking around in the settings etc and the phone already got warm.Overall, I'm loving this phone. I'll probably update this review once I get more hands on experience with it.

Reviews.Title: Phone Bliss
Reviews.Author: Danny
Reviews.Content: Over the last few years I've used several devices ranging from the OG Droid, Droid 2, and the Samsung Galaxy Nexus. I was on the market to purchase a new phone because I was looking for cheaper service and all of my phones were on Verizon's network. I've always been a Sony fanboy, and I already own their Tablet S, PSP, PS3, and Vaio. The Xperia ZL Allowed for seamless integration between them all, and shares data and media between them easily. The phone is comfortable to hold and doesn't feel too light or heavy. I opted for the ZL over the Z because i wanted the physical camera button, and I wasn't a huge fan of all the flaps that Sony had used on the Z to make it waterproof. The Camera quality is amazing and all of the filters and add-ons have been fun to use. Sony adds a slight skin on top of Jelly Bean 4.2, but only so that icons and transitions have been a little stylized, making it an easy transition from my Nexus device. I ditched my data plan with Verizon, and am using a call & txt plan with Red Pocket Mobile. I'm reliant on wi-fi for data, but surprisingly it hasn't been a problem. I would definitely recommend this phone to others who love a pretty screen, a good camera(13mp), and value a quality build.

Reviews.Title: Works with T-mobile HSPA+ but no LTE
Reviews.Author: Van Lam
Reviews.Content: Base on some commends on the web, sounded like this one would work with T-Mobile's LTE.  Well I give it a shot.  So far, I have tried to enable different radio software and all I got is HSPA+.  But the HSPA+ is faster than my Galaxy Nexus.  Good news is, this phone works with my $5.00 Tzone plan.  Will T-mobile stop it in a few days.... time will tell.The speaker is loud, but not clear like the HTC one.  I like the screen size and it's very stylish.  For $50 more, I would get the C6506 with LTE instead.

Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my Xperia ZL, it might not be as "top dog" as a GS4 but its competitiveness is certainly close behind and for a price that you definitely cant complain with as the device hold so much feature for a little above average user. The only real issue i find with the device is the battery power which i really think should be improved and i don't know if its just me but sometimes whenever the device is charging the touch seem a bit slow at responsiveness and getting to the camera app from the lock screen or even on an unlocked screen by long pressing the dedicated button is a bit slow but none-the-less it gets you there but other than those two obvious flaws i found so far it is absolutely fantastic and i love it, was definitely not a disappointment. I would recommend getting the Xperia Z or ZL without hesitating if your on a $500 budget and want something great and unlocked but cant find that extra $150 USD to reach for a GS4 or HTC One because you'll love it unless you're just downright biased at performance.

Reviews.Title: Solid Phone
Reviews.Author: Broken Flyer
Reviews.Content: Overall a great phone. While some may be put off by the aging software, Sony's tight user experience makes up for it in my mind. The hardware, while not the best available anymore, is still certainly top of the line and more than adequate for anything you might throw at it. The build quality is fantastic and the audio output sound quality in comparison to my old HTC One X is phenomenal(that phone did not sound good at all and had some awful white noise that was always present when listening to music).The only reason I didn't give this phone a full five stars is because of the screen, but I don't have a problem with the viewing angles as some people do. My problem is that it appears easier to scratch then the other smart phones I've seen recently and appears to scratch easier then my old HTC did. The camera is also fairly good and I think it has more accurate color portrayal them some other phones do(no fake over saturation). The Sony Xperia skin on top of android is very light as well and if you mix it with a launcher app it is very pleasant. The included music playing application works perfectly and it very easy to use. Far better than the experiences I've had with other companies included software.If you want a good quality phone that is a little more unique then some and aren't after the very latest in hardware/software I feel like this is a good solid, reliable, choice.

The built in memory is plenty for Apps and there is an easy port to add an SD Card. switching the phone to my carrier was simple too, all It took was to slip in the sim card (this applies for AT&T;) as it was the same size as the one for the Iphone. the Xperia support program that you can install to the PC took a bit of work, as long as you go to Computer and install from the phone not the site you should be fine. Get a screen protector, the screen is very large so there is alot of potential for scratches. The only major complaint that I have is that there is no Physical Home button but there is a portion of the screen that serves as the home button. also the power button is on the right side so that could take some adjustment. Reviews.Title: Amazing high end phone
Reviews.Author: Brett "Atdi"
Reviews.Content: A 5 inch incredible display in a small footprint plus so many great features that really add up to make this a fantastic smartphone.  My last phone was the Nexus 4 and although it is very fast and worked well in general, the really average to bad camera got me to start looking into phones that come with good cameras.  I read a lot of reviews and did a ton of research and ended up deciding on the ZL.  Glad I did. The camera is really a huge improvement and colors jump out with great resolution plus the camera software is point and shoot caliber,  I am very happy with the camera.  Beyond that I didn't expect much but the screen is sooo much better than the Nexus 4 it is shocking!  Esp for videos with the Bravia 2 engine built in, it really is amazing and has to be seen.  On top of that the FM radio is a nice plus and the IR Blaster is interesting as it actually works with my non Sony TV.  Bonus.  The inclusion of the SD card is another huge plus, already it has really come in handy.  In conclusion I truly never though I would end up with a Sony phone but am so happy with this purchase.  It looks and feels really high end with a lot of little touches that add up...

Reviews.Title: Freezing problems?
Reviews.Author: Mark Fraser
Reviews.Content: this is more of a question than a review, i bought this phone last November, we are now in March 2014, i have started to get a freezing problem on this phone and was wondering if anyone else has been experiencing it as well, the phone has not gotten wet or fell, and i only have regular social media apps installed on it, jellybean 4.3 update has been sent out but i have not gotten that update yet in my country, i am just bombed out by the fact this phone freezes on me, performing simple tasks such as answering calls, or even opening the album to view photos, the only way to unfreeze the phone is to open the flap in the back to press the "off" button, yes ive tried PC companion, yes ive tried sony's support forum/customerservice/support center, all to no reconcile, this phone should not be freezing like this, its a quad core phone, anyone has any ideas or possible resolve? the phone freezes randomly one day it will be fine, and then another, it will just freeze just like that (getting a lil hot) it's really frustrating, i actually still like the phone, at 3 stars, any advice or tips would be appreciated,
